creator: balask@hp.com
text:
Hi,

According to the URL,
http://ant.apache.org/manual/install.html#librarydependencies , Icontract.jar 
is a dependent library & can be obtained from http://www.reliable-
systems.com/tools/.

However, it looks like the site has been moved & we are not able to obtain the 
Icontract.jar. Can you please let me know how to find the Icontract.jar ?

Without this dependent jar file, build is failing.

Thanks,
Bala

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
the build is failing?  for what version of Ant?  icontract would be an optional
dependency; thus Ant would build, only ant-icontract.jar would be empty (absent
in HEAD builds).  So unless you actually need to use icontract, I can't imagine
what your problem could be.  I must assume you do not need to use it, or you
would already have the jar for this apparently defunct project.

creator: balask@hp.com
text:
yes you are right (my wording was wrong). I am getting an ant-icontract.jar 
which is empty. However, in the binary distribution in ant.apache.org, I am 
seeing ant-icontract.jar which is not empty. 

I am trying to certify ANT on HP_UX & our goal is that our distribution should 
exactly match with the binary distribution available in the open source. 

I don't have the *icontract.jar* with me.

I replied to this before having seen your conversation with Jan on the list...
at present I couldn't tell you where to procure a copy of this jar.
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text: I sent the jar by mail to mr balask. Hope this helps.
creator: antoine@apache.org
balask@hp.com
text:
Thanks Mr. Antoine Levy-Lambert . 

The jar which you had sent helped me to build ant-icontract.jar successfully. 

Thank you very much for your timely support. 

I will move this bug to FIXED.

Thanks,
Bala
